org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.mediation

Interface ThrottleSupport


  • public interface ThrottleSupport
    This interface defines the base for throttling implementations for the UltraESB. Implementations of this interface should implement the ThrottleSupport.isAllowed(org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.Message) method to provide the throttling functionality.
    Since:
    1.7.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOrUpdateRule(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String rule)
      Adds a rule to the existing throttle or update if it is already existing
      boolean isAllowed(Message message)
      Implementer should implement the throttling logic within this.
      boolean isAllowed(java.lang.String key, Message message)
      Throttling method implementation which takes in a category/key for evaluation - such as username, group, IP etc.

    • Method Detail

      • isAllowed

        boolean isAllowed(Message message)
        Implementer should implement the throttling logic within this. If the throttle logic allows this message to proceed then it should return true or if the message fails to satisfy the throttle logic false should be returned.
        Parameters:
        message - the current message to be used for validation
        Returns:
        true if the throttle configuration allows the message to proceed further, false otherwise

      • isAllowed

        boolean isAllowed(java.lang.String key,
                Message message)
        Throttling method implementation which takes in a category/key for evaluation - such as username, group, IP etc.
        Parameters:
        key - the category / key for the request
        message - message to throttle
        Returns:
        true if allowed, false otherwise

      • addOrUpdateRule

        void addOrUpdateRule(java.lang.String key,
                   java.lang.String rule)
        Adds a rule to the existing throttle or update if it is already existing
        Parameters:
        key - the rule kep to be added or updated
        rule - the rule to be added or updated
